intro: Sisymbrium domingense, commonly known as the Dominican mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other members of its family. Sisymbrium domingense is an important plant for local biodiversity and has ecological significance in its native environment.
